objects.name: OS API Execution
objects.description: Calls made by a process to operating system-provided Application Programming Interfaces (APIs). These calls are essential for interacting with system resources such as memory, files, and hardware, or for performing system-level tasks. Monitoring these calls can provide insight into a process's intent, especially if the process is malicious.

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:osquery
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: open, execve: Unexpected processes accessing or modifying critical files

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: API tracing / stack tracing via ETW or telemetry-based EDR

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Invocation of SMLoginItemSetEnabled by non-system or recently installed application

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Directory-Services-SAM
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: api_call: Calls to DsAddSidHistory or related RPC operations

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: application logs referencing NSTimer, sleep, or launchd delays

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: High-frequency or suspicious sequence of QueryPerformanceCounter/GetTickCount API calls from a non-standard process lineage

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Rules capturing clock_gettime, time, gettimeofday syscalls when enabled

x_mitre_log_sources.name: networkdevice:syslog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Unexpected reload, crashinfo, or boot message not tied to scheduled maintenance

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-RPC
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: rpc_call: srvsvc.NetShareEnum / NetShareEnumAll from non-admin or unusual processes

x_mitre_log_sources.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: smb_command: TreeConnectAndX to \\*\IPC$ / srvsvc or Trans2/NT_CREATE for listing shares

x_mitre_log_sources.name: EDR:memory
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: API usage MFCreateDeviceSource, IAMStreamConfig, ICaptureGraphBuilder2, DirectShow filter graph creation from uncommon callers

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: openat/read/ioctl: openat/read/ioctl on /dev/video* by uncommon user/process

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Access decisions to kTCCServiceCamera for unexpected binaries

x_mitre_log_sources.name: EDR:memory
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Objective‑C/Swift calls to AVCaptureDevice/AVCaptureSession by non-whitelisted processes

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: mmap, ptrace, process_vm_writev or direct memory ops

x_mitre_log_sources.name: WinEventLog:Application
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: API call to AddMonitor invoked by non-installer process

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: unshare, mount, keyctl, setns syscalls executed by containerized processes

x_mitre_log_sources.name: WinEventLog:Microsoft-Windows-COM/Operational
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: CLSID activation events where ProcessName=mmc.exe and CLSID not in allowed baseline

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: send, recv, write: Abnormal interception or alteration of transmitted data

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:osquery
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: CALCULATE: Integrity validation of transmitted data via hash checks

x_mitre_log_sources.name: ETW:Token
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: token_analysis: API calls such as DuplicateTokenEx or ImpersonateLoggedOnUser

x_mitre_log_sources.name: EDR:memory
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: VirtualAlloc/VirtualProtect/MapViewOfFile indicators via stack/heap activity and ImageLoad

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:MMAP
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: memory region with RWX permissions allocated

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: ptrace: Processes invoking ptrace with PTRACE_TRACEME flag

x_mitre_log_sources.name: esxi:hostd
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Remote access API calls and file uploads

x_mitre_log_sources.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Execution of modified binaries or abnormal library load sequences

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Calls to AuthorizationExecuteWithPrivileges() observed via Apple System Logger or security_auditing tools

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: access or unlock attempt to keychain database

x_mitre_log_sources.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Execution of input detection APIs (e.g., CGEventSourceKeyState)

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: mount system call with bind or remap flags

x_mitre_log_sources.name: fs:fsusage
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: Detached process execution with no associated parent

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: api_call: UpdateProcThreadAttribute (PROC_THREAD_ATTRIBUTE_PARENT_PROCESS) and CreateProcess* with EXTENDED_STARTUPINFO_PRESENT / StartupInfoEx

x_mitre_log_sources.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: execve of dd or sed targeting /proc/*/mem

x_mitre_log_sources.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_sources.channel: WriteProcessMemory: WriteProcessMemory targeting regions containing KernelCallbackTable addresses
